data.text: The period of a woman's life characterized by physiological changes associated with the end of reproductive capacity, terminating with the completion of menopause.
data.attributionText: from The American HeritageÂ® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: The physiological stage menstruating women go through when approaching <xref>menopause</xref>, when, due to hormonal changes, they progress from their usual pattern of <xref>menstruation</xref> through a phase of atypical menstruation, and finally cease menstruating. Perimenopause ends when a woman has not menstruated for a year.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.
